channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In a fraught political moment, one woman finds comfort on her morning commute
item.description: In 2008, when banning same-sex marriage in California was put on the ballot, Kate Elsley's commute changed. Seeing signs supporting the ban became a r...

item.title: Democratic voters say California's Prop 50 gives them a way to 'counteract' Trump
item.description: Many voters told NPR they like that California's redistricting measure provides the Democratic-leaning state a rare opportunity to directly counteract...

item.title: Andrew Cuomo fights for his political life and his version of the Democratic Party
item.description: Former N.Y. Gov. Andrew Cuomo has a long list of accomplishments, many of them progressive. In the race for New York City mayor, that experience hasn'...

item.title: Gender inequality accelerates Japan's rural depopulation
item.description: Akita Prefecture has Japan's most aged population, lowest birthrate and fastest declining population. Rigid gender roles are prompting young women to ...

item.title: Despite a ceasefire, Israel has demolished villages in southern Lebanon
item.description: Along Lebanon's border, Israel has continued demolitions and attacks despite a ceasefire in the country's war with Hezbollah last year.

item.title: Trump administration faces a deadline to tell judges whether it will use contingency funds for SNAP
Latino voters cite affordability, economy as top concerns in new poll
item.description: According to the Unidos Bipartisan Poll of Hispanic Voters: The Road to 2026, 53% of Latino voters cite the cost of living and inflation as their lead...

item.title: 5 climbers, including dad and teen daughter, killed by avalanche
item.description: Two men and a woman were recovered dead on Saturday, while the bodies of a man and his 17-year-old daughter were found on Sunday.

item.title: Valencia leader resigns over handling of deadly floods
item.description: A year after flash floods killed 229 people in the Valencia region, Carlos Mazón acknowledged "mistakes" were made.

item.title: FDA's top drug regulator quits as agency officials probe actions
item.description: The FDA's top drug regulator, Dr. George Tidmarsh, quit after federal officials began reviewing "serious concerns about his personal conduct," a gover...

item.title: Public barred as Tanzanian president sworn in
item.description: President Samia faced little opposition with key rivals either imprisoned or barred from running.

item.title: At least 20 people killed as powerful quake hits northern Afghanistan
item.description: Afghanistan's Taliban government says a powerful earthquake in the country's north has killed at least 20 people and left hundreds injured.

item.title: Hamas returns 3 more Israeli hostages' remains, leaving 8 still in Gaza
item.description: Among the 8 deceased Israeli hostages whose remains are yet to be returned from Gaza is soldier and U.S. citizen Itay Chen.

item.title: Justin Baldoni case against Blake Lively dismissed after deadline lapse
item.description: The actor and director's $400m lawsuit against his former co-star is formally ended by a US judge.

item.title: Clooney says Harris replacing Biden was a 'mistake'
item.description: The actor - a prominent Democratic fundraiser - also says he has no regrets about calling for Biden to quit the US presidential race.

item.title: Israeli military's ex-top lawyer arrested as scandal over video leak deepens
item.description: Maj Gen Yifat Tomer-Yerushalmi resigned on Friday, admitting leaking the video allegedly showing abuse of a Palestinian detainee.

item.title: Hearings to focus on National Guard deployments in the nation’s capital and Memphis, Tennessee
item.description: Hearings are set in two states over the deployment of the National Guard as part of President Donald Trump’s crime-fighting efforts.

item.title: Judge again bars Trump administration from deploying troops to Portland
